meanings.definition: A published false statement that is damaging to a person's reputation.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper published a libel about the mayor, causing a lot of trouble.
meanings.sent2: The court case focused on the libel written in the magazine.
meanings.sent3: It would be a silly libel to say that the cat can speak English.
meanings.sent4: The rumor spread like a libel through the small town.
meanings.sent5: The libel written on the bathroom wall was quickly erased.

meanings.sent1: He threatened to libel the company if they didn't pay him off.
meanings.sent2: She was accused of trying to libel her ex-boyfriend on social media.
meanings.sent3: I wouldn't libel my best friend even as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The angry customer decided to libel the restaurant online.
meanings.sent5: The author chose to libel the politician in his new book.
